Posted Job Title
Machine Learning Analyst (Hybrid Eligible)

Job Profile Title
Application Developer C

Job Description Summary
The Advancement Prospect Analytics department is responsible for providing Development and Alumni Relations staff with data driven decision making tools to support the operational needs of Advancement at Penn. The department identifies the most actional prospects, disseminates reports, executive summaries and analysis documents to each of the 18 schools within the University as well as central Development and Alumni Relations staff. Machine learning, statistical inference and data mining techniques are used to provide staff with actionable insight to utilize complex data collections throughout the institution.

Job Description

The Machine Learning Analyst reports to the Director of Advancement Prospect Analytics and is responsible for developing statistical modelling and machine learning techniques to identify the best potential prospects for the University and make prospect recommendations to units that best align with a prospect's philanthropic history and demonstrated interest areas. A knowledge of data warehousing environments such as Oracle and Snowflake and associated SQL query tools is required. Demonstrated experience with statistical programming languages and tools such as R, Python or SAS is a requirement. In addition to prospect identification and segmentation, the Machine Learning Analyst is responsible for providing statistically informed tools to drive strategic decisions and to identify and share performance trends. Many projects will be long term and require extensive project management, communication and requirements gathering in collaboration with colleagues across multiple units. Metrics for model performance will be established to measure effectiveness and existing models will need to be continually evaluated and improved to yield the best results. They key performance indicators will be positive post research outcomes such as prospect assignments, visits, asks and gifts.

Specific Responsibilities

Implements machine learning techniques to highlight performance trends and identify the best potential prospects for the University using statistical programming languages and tools such as R, Python or SAS.

Delivers statistical model outputs using advancement software systems such as Salesforce NPSP, data visualization and query tools QlikView, Business Objects, RStudio, SQL and other systems to users.

Designs, codes, simulates, tests, implements and maintains reporting solutions and associated middleware, interfaces and databases in highly complex solutions.

Analyzes functional requirements and advises users in the planning, selection, implementation and use of solutions to address business requirements.

Monitors and improves applications, providing technical and application support.

Ensures adherence to technical, quality assurance, data integrity, and security standards.

**Please provide a resume and cover letter in order to be considered for this role. Please upload all documents in the "Resume/CV" section of the application prior to submitting.**

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree with a focus on machine learning and 2-3 years of equivalent programming, machine learning or systems analysis experience or equivalent combination of education and experience required. A strong command of data analysis tools and query languages (Crystal Reports, Business Objects and SQL), data programming, mining and modeling languages (R, Python) and data visualization tools (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI) is a requirement. Experience in fundraising information systems and fundraising business practices is strongly recommended. Demonstrated expertise in process redesign, systems analysis and design and the ability to quickly learn and apply new technologies.

Job Profile Title
Data Analyst C

Job Description Summary
The Clinical Research Computing Unit (CRCU) is an Academic Clinical Research Organization within the Center for Clinical Epidemiology and Biostatistics (CCEB) in the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania. Since its inception in 1997, the CRCU has been expertly providing the full range of services essential for the conduct of clinical research projects, including Phase I-IV, multi-center, randomized, clinical trials, registry, and cohort studies utilizing state-of-the-art technology and tools to ensure superior data quality. The CRCU provides expertise in project management, data coordination and research computing tailored to meet your project requirements. The CRCU project teams' partner with the Biostatistics Analysis Center (BAC) in the project design phase to plan accurate and precise data collection modules and to structure project reports for steady oversight. We specialize in study design and development, site management and training, data collection, processing, quality control, regulatory requirements and reporting, database development, administration, security, data storage and proposal development.

Job Description

This is a primary data manager position responsible for the design, development and implementation of large, multi-site Data Coordinating Center projects as well as smaller, UPENN based clinical trials. This includes systems developed using REDCap or Oracle Clinical for purposes of FDA 21 CFR part 11 compliant projects.

Position contingent upon funding.


Provide technical collaborative services to MD and PhD faculty (including investigators at external sites) in the development of research protocols and clinical data management systems for projects involving the resources of the CRCU. This includes data requirement and data management system analysis, design specifications and technical documentation related to FDA regulatory guidelines, as applicable and primary end-user support.

Design /develop case report forms, and manuals of operations for various distributed, web-based, or local data management systems in support of CRCU projects.

Design, document and execute validation specifications/ procedures and reports, relative to project requirements and applicable FDA regulatory guidelines.

Interact with internal project staff and external clinical staff to manage data flow, resolve queries, and ensure data quality and adherence to MOP.


Bachelor's degree and 2-3 years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience required.

Master degree preferred (M.S.) in health or science.

Experience, 2-3 years, in work with multi-center, multi-protocol, single-or multi-disease clinical studies.

Substantial experience in developing Case Report Forms, protocols and manuals of operation.

Substantial experience in the development of clinical data management infrastructure such as standards, guidelines and procedures.

Ability to interact effectively with many levels of faculty, staff and administrative personnel is required.

A demonstrated ability to effectively present complex information is required.

This position may require flexibility to work evenings/nights/weekends.

Implement algorithms (write code) to facilitate research or disseminate results in either Python, Java, Matlab, Javascript, or C++.
Examine and maintain data in MySQL and NoSQL style databases.
Perform technical literature reviews, including identifying relevant papers in computer science and writing accessible summaries for the team.

Penn offers generous retirement plans to help you save for your future. Penn's Basic, Matching, and Supplemental retirement plans allow you to save for retirement on a pre-tax or Roth basis. Choose from a wide variety of investment options through TIAA and Vanguard.

Penn provides you with a substantial amount of time away from work during the course of the year. This allows you to relax, take vacations, attend to personal affairs, recover from illness or injury, spend time with family-whatever your personal needs may be.

In partnership with Genworth Financial, Penn offers faculty and staff (and your eligible family members) long-term care insurance to help you cover some of the costs of long-term care services received at home, in the community or in a nursing facility. If you apply when you're newly hired, you won't have to provide proof of good health or be subject to underwriting requirements. Eligible family members must always provide proof of good health and are subject to underwriting.

Penn is committed to supporting our faculty and staff as they balance the competing demands of work and personal life. That's why we offer a wide variety of programs and resources to help you care for your health, your family, and your work-life balance.

Penn provides an array of resources to help you advance yourself personally and professionally.

As a member of the Penn community, you have access to a wide range of University resources as well as cultural and recreational activities. Take advantage of the University's libraries and athletic facilities, or visit our arboretum and art galleries. There's always something going on at Penn, whether it's a new exhibit at the Penn Museum, the latest music or theater presentation at the Annenberg Center, or the Penn Relays at Franklin Field to name just a few examples. As a member of the Penn community, you're right in the middle of the excitement-and you and your family can enjoy many of these activities for free.

From arts and entertainment to transportation and mortgages, you'll find great deals for University faculty and staff. Not only do Penn arts and cultural centers and museums offer free and discounted admission and memberships to faculty and staff. You can also enjoy substantial savings on other goods and services such as new cars from Ford and General Motors, cellular phone service plans, movie tickets, and admission to theme parks.

Flexible work options offer creative approaches for completing work while promoting balance between work and personal commitments. These approaches involve use of non-traditional work hours, locations, and/or job structures.

Penn offers a forgivable loan for eligible employees interested in buying a home or currently residing in West Philadelphia, which can be used for closing costs or home improvements.

Penn will reimburse eligible employees on qualified expenses in connection with the legal adoption of an eligible child, such as travel or court fees, for up to two adoptions in your household.
